result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon M Baxter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Brandon M Baxter
parties.address: 8907 County Road CC, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235

miscConds.notes: Pay $100 fine plus costs. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full time employment and/or school as determined by DOC.
Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. No contact direct or indirect with victim.
Defendant is eligible for expungement under Wis. Stat. 973.015 upon successful completion of Probation and all conditions.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Submit DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: Stayed, to be used at discretion of Court through petition by Dept. of Corrections.
Perform 10 hours of uncompensated community service for non-profit agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Good time and Huber privileges granted. Report forthwith.
Outstanding financial obligations are reduced to civil judgment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Brandon M Baxter in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers. Defendant Brandon M Baxter in custody. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters guilty/no contest plea to Count          . Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea(s) made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea(s), and finds Defendant guilty of Count(s)               .

Defendant Brandon M Baxter in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers. Defendant Brandon M Baxter in custody. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews receipt of Revocation Order and Warrant. State/Defense make sentencing recommendations. Defendant makes statement. Court makes statement, imposes sentence.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on June 7, 2016 at 04:00 pm.

Defendant Brandon M Baxter in court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity, questions Defendant on progress with State. Defendant received offer he wants to accept. State advises of offer made to Defendant. Court questions Defendant on continued waiver of right to Counsel, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest plea. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty. State makes sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.
No contact direct or indirect with KL.  Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.

Defendant Brandon M Baxter in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, right to counsel. Defendant doesn't plan to get an attorney. Court advises Defendant that he will need to go through colloquy about self-representation, reviews options. Defendant wants to try to resolve matter with DA, waives right to Counsel. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver. Defendant to make appointment with DA. Bond set.  Status conference scheduled for April 26, 2016 at 10:30 am.
